barter is the exchange of goods and services for other goods and services without the use of money. this section will allow you to test your knowledge on barter and money click here and let us begin click here and let us begin click here and let us begin click here and let us begin click here and let us begin click here and let us begin

let’s recall the functions of money. match the statements on the left with the functions listed on the right. my tv can be purchased on hire purchase means of deferred payment a pair of nike shoes for $400.00 is worth ten times more than a cap. this functions deals with the prices of items. standard of value it makes easy the exchange of currency for purchase goods and services price mechanism it can be saved up and used to purchase a jeep in four year’s time. store of value

restart course restart course restart course we have fully reviewed barter and mediums of exchange and payment. we have learnt what is barter and the different mediums of exchange and payments. we were able to make practical applications to ensure that the concepts were fully understood. let us keep up the good work as we move forward. thanks for completing the course exit course

there are two main sectors of an economy. they are the public and the private sector. let us see what we can remember about these two sectors by engaging in the activities. click here to begin click here to begin click here to begin click here to begin click here to begin click here to begin
partnership a a a a b b b b cooperative c c c c joint venture d d d d sole trader sandra has opened an account in st. john’s credit union on all saints road. this is known as a multiple choice
government a a a a b b b b shareholders c c c c employees d d d d municipal the owners of a public limited company are the multiple choice
private compnay a a a a b b b b franchise c c c c public company d d d d joint venture an incorporated company that offers shares to the public is called a multiple choice

submit in the absence of a partnership deed, profits and losses in a partnership must be shared in accordance with the companies act of 1967 in accordance with the companies act of 1967 in accordance with the companies act of 1967 in accordance with the companies act of 1967 in accordance with the companies act of 1967 in accordance with the companies act of 1967 in proportion to the capital provided by each partner in proportion to the capital provided by each partner in proportion to the capital provided by each partner in proportion to the capital provided by each partner in proportion to the capital provided by each partner in proportion to the capital provided by each partner depending upon the role each partner plays in the business depending upon the role each partner plays in the business depending upon the role each partner plays in the business depending upon the role each partner plays in the business depending upon the role each partner plays in the business depending upon the role each partner plays in the business equally amongst all owners of the business equally amongst all owners of the business equally amongst all owners of the business equally amongst all owners of the business equally amongst all owners of the business equally amongst all owners of the business multiple choice
which of the following business organizations has its shares traded on the stock exchange?
type your text here an association of 2 to 20 individuals operating a business to make a profit is called a
type your text here the process of transferring a business from the private sector to the public sector is referred to as
true true true true true true false false false false false false an economy is a system in which production, distribution and consumption takes place
true true true true true true false false false false false false kfc and subway are all examples of private limited companies.

true true true true true true false false false false false false limited liability means that the maximum sum that the company’s owners have to pay out to meet debts is the sum they invested in the business
true true true true true true false false false false false false a sole trader business has limited liability.
apua supplies utilities to the country of antigua and barbuda. this is a private sector private limited company public sector public limited company
owned by private shareholders and shares are not openly traded on a stock exchange private sector private limited company public sector public limited company
small, medium and even large-scale businesses private sector private limited company public sector public limited company

question 3 question 3 submit submit submit submit submit submit private enterprises are profit driven and therefore efficient private enterprises are profit driven and therefore efficient private enterprises are profit driven and therefore efficient it allows for wide share ownership it allows for wide share ownership it allows for wide share ownership it can enjoy monopoly power it can enjoy monopoly power it can enjoy monopoly power the following are benefits of privatization except government earns revenue from taxes government earns revenue from taxes government earns revenue from taxes government earns revenue from taxes government earns revenue from taxes government earns revenue from taxes

question 1 buy why, some say, the moon? why choose this as our goal? and they may as well ask why climb the highest mountain? that's one small step for [a] man, one giant leap for mankind. incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect correct correct correct correct correct correct incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect

question 2 what was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that man set foot on the moon but that they set eye on the earth. astronomy compels the soul to look upward and leads us from this world to another. incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect correct correct correct correct correct correct incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect

question 3 never in all their history have men been able truly to conceive of the world as one: a single sphere, a globe, having the qualities of a globe, a round earth in which all the directions eventually meet. incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect correct correct correct correct correct correct incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect

incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect correct correct correct correct correct correct incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect question 4 spaceflights are not the work of any one man or even a group of men. it is a historical process which mankind is carrying out in accordance with the natural laws of human development.

incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect correct correct correct correct correct correct incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect incorrect question 5 dinosaurs are extinct today because they lacked opposable thumbs and the brainpower to build a space program.
